title: ICE Shooting Spree - 16 Incidents, 4 Deaths
summary: At least 16 shooting incidents by federal immigration officials since Trump's second term began. Four deaths and at least seven injuries. Deaths include Keith Porter (43, Los Angeles New Year's Eve), Silverio Villegas González (Chicago suburb), 31-year-old Mexican citizen (Rio Grande City, Texas), and Renee Good (37, Minneapolis U.S. citizen). Former ICE acting director: shootings are 'a direct byproduct' of tactic shift. DHS claimed '1,300% increase in assaults' but blamed 'radical rhetoric by sanctuary politicians.'
keyFacts: At least 16 shooting incidents by federal immigration officials since Trump's second term began
Four deaths and at least seven injuries
Seven officer-involved shootings by DHS agents, two fatal
Keith Porter (43): Fatally shot by off-duty ICE agent on New Year's Eve in Los Angeles
Silverio Villegas González: Father from Mexico killed in September while reportedly trying to flee in Chicago suburb
31-year-old Mexican citizen: Killed by border patrol agent in December in Rio Grande City, Texas
Renee Good (37): U.S. citizen and mother of three killed in Minneapolis January 7, 2026
Former ICE acting director: shootings are 'a direct byproduct' of tactic shift
Shootings occurred across country in Chicago, Los Angeles, Minnesota - areas with heightened ICE presence
DHS claimed '1,300% increase in assaults against ICE officers' and '3,200% increase in vehicular attacks'
DHS blamed 'radical rhetoric by sanctuary politicians' for attacks

sources.text: DHS: Radical Rhetoric by Sanctuary Politicians Leads to Unprecedented 1,300% Increase in Assaults Against ICE Officers
NPR: White House claims 'more than 1,000%' rise in assaults on ICE agents, data says otherwise
